intro: Zephyranthes pseudocrocus, commonly known as the rain lily, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with seasonal rainfall. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming after rainfall. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in warm climates. Zephyranthes pseudocrocus is also known for its ability to bloom quickly after rain, earning it its common name.
